title: Can you become an American rapper even if you're not American and don't live there? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I kind of think you can’t. I mean, if you live in Europe, for example, and you’re a rapper, you would not be an American rapper. You would be a European rapper. And I realize that Europe isn’t a country, I’m just trying to make sure I don’t offend any specific countries in Europe. Now, if your real question is “can you sell your music in America even if you’re not an American and don’t live there?”, the answer is obviously yes, regardless of the genre of your music.
10 Rappers Born Outside The U.S. - XXL US record and concert sales suggest some of these have had little problem with “cred”
